instructions: Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 1 1 Open the Calendars app on your iPhone. The app icon should show the current date on a white background. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 2 2 Tap on at the bottom of the screen. If you're on an event page, you'll have to navigate back to the main calendar view to see the Calendars button. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 3 3 Find the account or specific calendar that you want to hide. The calendars will be displayed by account. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 4 4 Uncheck the radio button next to the calendar you want to hide. You can turn off every calendar associated with an email address by tapping the "Hide All" button, or you can choose specific calendars to hide by unchecking the radio button. To edit event color for a specific calendar, click on the button and select a color. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 5 5 Tap in the upper right corner of the screen. The events from the calendar or account that you hid should no longer show up in your calendar. Advertisement

Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 6 1 Open Image titled Iphonesettingsappicon.png Settings on your iPhone. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 7 2 Scroll down and tap on . Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 8 3 Tap on an account under the section. Image titled Delete Calendars on iPhone Step 9 4 Slide the switch next to Calendars to the off position Image titled Iphoneswitchofficon.png . 5 Tap on to remove the account completely. The Delete Account button is at the bottom of the screen. Deleting the account completely will unsubscribe you from the calendar and remove it and any associated events from the Calendars app, as well as removing the mail, contacts, and notes associated with that account from your phone.
